member.param: Item to add to the heap.

member.name: M:Dsa.DataStructures.Heap`1.Clear
member.summary: Clears the of its items.
member.remarks: Calling this method returns the internal to it's original capacity of 4.

member.name: M:Dsa.DataStructures.Heap`1.Contains(`0)
member.summary: Determines whether or not the contains a specific item.

remarks.para: This is an O(n) operation where n is the number of items in the .

Algorithm is optimised to categorically rule out a value being in the heap if the value we are looking for is > than the parent of each node at the current level, but less than each node at the current level. The opposite strategy is used when searching a max-heap. Worse case is still linear, but now in some scenarios we can give a definitive answer without traversing all the values in the heap.

member.param: Item to see if the Heap contains.
member.returns: True is the item if in the Heap; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Dsa.DataStructures.Heap`1.Remove(`0)
member.summary: Removes an item from the .
member.remarks: This method is an O(n) operation.
member.param: Item to remove from the Heap.
member.returns: True if the item was found and removed; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Dsa.DataStructures.Heap`1.ToArray
member.summary: Converts the to a one-dimensional array.
member.remarks: This method is an O(n) operation where n is the number of items in the .
member.returns: A one-dimensional containing the values of the nodes contained in the .

member.name: M:Dsa.DataStructures.Heap`1.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through the in breadth first order.
member.remarks: This method is an O(n) operation where n is the number of items in the .
member.returns: An for the .

member.name: M:Dsa.DataStructures.Heap`1.GreaterThanParent(System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.Comparer{`0})
member.summary: Determines whether or not an item at the given index is greater than its parent.
member.returns: True if the item at the provided index is greater than its parent; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Dsa.DataStructures.Heap`1.LessThanParent(System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.Comparer{`0})
member.summary: Determines whether or not an item at the given index is less than its parent.
member.returns: True if the item at the provided index is less than its parent; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Dsa.DataStructures.Heap`1.MinHeapify
member.summary: Min heapifies the .

remarks.para: This method is an O(log n) operation.
The key of the parent is less than or equal to that of its child, this property holds throughout the Heap :. the key at the root of the Heap is the smallest key in the Heap.

member.name: M:Dsa.DataStructures.Heap`1.MaxHeapify
member.summary: Max heapifies the .

remarks.para: This method is an O(log n) operation.
The key of the parent is greater than or equal to that of its child, this property holds throughout the Heap :. the key at the root of the Heap is the greatest key in the Heap.

member.name: P:Dsa.DataStructures.Heap`1.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the item at the specified index.
member.returns: Item at the specified index.

member.name: T:Dsa.DataStructures.Heap`1.ParentHandler
member.summary: Used for the first predicate of the method.
member.returns: True if the predicate is satisfied; otherwise false.

member.name: T:Dsa.DataStructures.Heap`1.ComparerHandler
member.summary: Used for the second predicate of the method. Determines whether the item is less than or greater than some other item. The behaviour depends on the type of the being used.
member.returns: True if the predicate is satisfied; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Dsa.DataStructures.SinglyLinkedList`1.RemoveLast
member.summary: Removes the last node from the .
member.remarks: This method's best case is an O(1) operation when the last node to remove is both the head and tail, i.e. there is only one node in the linked list, otherwise the method is an O(n) operation where n nodes have to be traversed in order to locate the node that precedes the last node.
member.returns: True the last node was removed; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Dsa.Algorithms.Strings.Any(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the index of the first character in the match that matches any character in the word .

remarks.para: This method is an O(n^2) operation.

member.param: Word to run the any match against.
The of characters to match against the word.
member.returns: A non-negative index that represents the location of the first character in the match that was also in the word ; otherwise -1 if no characters in the match matched any of the characters in the word .
member.exception: word is null or match is null.

member.name: M:Dsa.Algorithms.Strings.IsPalindrome(System.String)
member.summary: Detects whether or not the input string is a palindrome.

remarks.para: This method is an O(n) operation where n is the number of chars to traverse in order to verify the string is a palindrome.
Case, whitespace, punctuation and symbols are ignored.

member.param: that you want to verify is a palindrome.
member.returns: True if the string is a palindrome; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Dsa.Algorithms.Strings.Strip(System.String)
member.summary: Takes a and strips it of whitespace, punctuation and symbols returning the resulting stripped .
member.remarks: This methods is an O(n) operation where n is the number of chars in the string to strip.
member.returns: The stripped version of the .

member.param: The to count the words of.
member.returns: An indicating the number of words in the .

member.name: M:Dsa.Algorithms.Strings.ReverseWords(System.String)
member.summary: Reverses the words of a string.

member.returns: with original words in reverse order.

member.name: M:Dsa.Algorithms.Strings.RepeatedWordCount(System.String)
member.summary: Counts the number of words that are repeated within a string.
member.remarks: This method is an O(n) operation where n is the number of words in the string delimited by whitespace.
member.returns: Number of words repeated in the given string.

member.name: M:Dsa.Algorithms.Numbers.ToHex(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts a positive base 10 integer into it's hexadecimal counterpart (base 16).
member.param: Integer to convert to hexadecimal form.
member.returns: Hexadecimal (base 16) representation of value.

member.name: M:Dsa.Algorithms.Numbers.IsPrime(System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines whether or not an integer is a prime number.
member.param: Number to check is a prime.
member.returns: True if the number is a prime; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Dsa.Algorithms.Numbers.MaxValue(Dsa.Algorithms.Base,System.Int32)
member.summary: Computes the maximum value that a given number base can hold for N digits.
member.returns: Maximum value for the given number base with the number of digits specified.

member.name: M:Dsa.Algorithms.Numbers.GetHexSymbol(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets char symbol for hex numbers 10 .. 15 (A .. F).
member.param: Integer to get hex symbol for.
member.returns: Hex symbol for that number.
